title: "Then Weight Of Days" Art deco-ish geometric sans
content:
Anybody?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006024011im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DYSBA_4153.jpg)

 [‹ A sans, scanned and re-vectorized?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006024011/http:/typophile.com/node/50045 "Go to previous forum topic") [T-shirt font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006024011/http:/typophile.com/node/50068 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Renasci

comments.content:
I think this looks like it could be done as a composite of [Horatio Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006024011/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/horatio/) and/or a font called [Harry/Hammer](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006024011/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces6B.html) (samples from Bauhaus-style Font ID Guide). The only missing letter is the W, which could be made with two V’s from either of these fonts.

- Mike Yanega

Looks hand drawn to me. Also similar: [Penumbra](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006024011/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/penumbra_sans_std_light/?sample_text=THE%20WEIGHT%20OF%20DAYS)
